results.text: You’ve picked up on this individual’s mannerisms faster than normal. You have advantage on your next Insight check against the target creature.
You caught them in one lie and you’re sure it won’t be the last. For the next minute, if the target creature attempts to lie to you again you automatically succeed in detecting it.
Your hunches are rarely wrong, especially when they come to people. You glean the target’s surface thoughts (as in the spell @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.4rgo85d49qwancup]{Detect Thoughts}).
You’re in tune with the emotions of those around you. You gain an expertise die to checks made to discern the feelings and emotions of others. This bonus lasts until you complete a long rest.

You’ve watched people long enough to gauge how they feel about you with great accuracy. You automatically determine the creature’s current attitude towards you (i.e., friendly, indifferent, angry, etc.)

Through the use of subtle gestures or knowing looks, you clue in one of your allies to your suspicions. Your ally may add half of your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to their next Insight check against the same target.
